intro: Hemandradenia, commonly known as the golden mistflower, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its showy, yellow to orange composite flowers that resemble daisies. The plant typically has narrow, grass-like leaves and grows in a variety of habitats, including woodlands and open fields. Hemandradenia species are often found in temperate regions of the Americas. Its botanical features make it a valuable addition to native plant gardens and ecological restoration projects.
